title-group.article-title: Automatic Dividend Reinvestment Plans of Nonfinancial Corporations

abstract.p: An increasing number of nonfinancial corporations are allowing stockholders to reinvest dividends directly. This paper describes the extent of the use of automatic dividend reinvestment (ADR) and the operations, costs, advantages, and disadvantages involved. A profile is developed to distinguish industrial ADR users from non-users. Data from a survey of the S&P 500 firms provides an insight into the stockholder's acceptance of these plans and the influence of these plans upon dividend policy.
